isis.stitle: TSI 05-08-09 - Headlight Aiming Procedure for CF Model Trucks

subjectgroup.subject: Headlight Aiming Procedure for CF Model Trucks

geninfo.para: The headlight aim of the CF Models should be checked after the body has been installed and adjusted if necessary. The body and payload weight has an effect on the aiming of the headlights. Should it be necessary to readjust the headlights on CF Models, follow the procedure listed below.

svcproc.title: Service procedure
svcproc.para: The CF headlights should be properly aimed using the procedure described in S08307. When performing the headlight adjustment it is important to follow the procedures closely. During the adjustment process both the inboard and outboard vertical aim adjustment screws should be turned the same amount and in the same direction. Turning the screws in opposite directions could result in damage to, and the need to replace, the headlight assembly. Also note that you should not finish the adjustment procedure while turning the adjusting screws in the counterclockwise direction. If you are adjusting in the counterclockwise direction, turn the adjusting screws one full turn beyond the proper adjustment point and then turn the screws back clockwise one full turn so you finish with the proper adjustment while turning the screws in the clockwise direction.
